mads.note: Brill's New Pauly: "Olympus, Culture hero from Asia Minor. The name O. refers to a Mysian of prehistoric times, before the Trojan War, as well as to a Phrygian from the 8th cent. BC..... While he was considered in antiquity to be a historical figure, O. is regarded today as a prṓtos heuretḗs ('primordial originator') [1. 53ff.] and as a composite figure representing a fusion of the Greek and the oriental....." Harmon, Roger (Basle). “Olympus”, in: Brill’s New Pauly, Antiquity volumes edited by: Hubert Cancik and , Helmuth Schneider. Consulted online on 11 September 2017
